content.detailedDescription: Three of us were sitting out at a fire pit and i noticed an orange object in the sky. i noticed it because it wasn't pulsating but coming closer. when i alerted the two other people with me, we all stood up and watched it move from a straight path to a zig zag pattern. it first came in straight from the north east and then moved to a south west pattern. while doing so, it made some zig zags while still moving. it's color was orange and solid. nothing was pulsating like a plane.
content.summary: Orange yellow object moving ne to sw

content.detailedDescription: We were leaving my moms home and my husband looked to the east to see a white light, that then disappeared. i told him it was a street lamp or an airplane, since there's always a lot of airplane activity. we took of driving east and the object seemed to have disappeared. driving down a main street i looked up and the ufo appeared because it lit up again then dimmed out. 10 seconds later it appeared again in a different area, moved much to fast to be a man made object. i was terrified and wanted to cry. we lost track after we starting heading north again.
content.summary: Dimmed in and out in a series of 10 minutes, changed directions.

content.detailedDescription: Will be submiting full story soon.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Other
content.shape: Boomerang,   Bullet,   Missile,   Circle,   Fireball,   Flash,   Sphere,   Teardrop,   Triangle
content.summary: I was at emerald bay boy scout camp at parson's landing on catalina island.  myself and approximately 20 people were watching this amazing sky show of ufos

content.detailedDescription: My girlfriend and i were out front of our home around 11:00 p.M. and i saw an orange light high above us moving from east to west. i said to her look hon i think that might be a satellite. we watched the object go till it disappeared behind a cloud. the object the came out of the cloud moving in the opposite direction (west to east) then changed to a northwest heading. we were stunned. the very next night we were out around 11:30 p.M. and saw a bright red orange light slowly ascend from behind some trees. i had my camera so i took a picture but my camera didn't want to focus right so the picture doesn't look like what we saw, it looks like a speck in the picture when in reality it was much bigger. 15-20 minutes later i went back out to see if i could see it again and i saw it hovering near the tree line in the opposite direction i saw it 15-20 minutes earlier.
content.summary: My girlfriend and i saw an orange light go into a cloud then come out and go in a different direction.

content.detailedDescription:
i was driving to meet a friend.  i was running somewhat late and while looking to my right i saw the object in the sky.  the sky was darkening but there was enough light left as i looked to the northeast that the ufo was dark against the lighter grey sky behind it.

i think what i saw was a 3/4 view with the object angled somewhat towards me.  it was traveling very slowly (if at all)in a southeastern direction.

unlike the triangles so often described, this did not have a flat bottom but rather looked like the typical, standard star wars star destroyer but with no detail-- just the general shape including the vertical section between the top and bottom.  so what i saw had basically an exact symmetry top and bottom.  also, unlike the star wars vehicle, the object i observed did not have that command bridge at the back.  after three-quarters of a mild rise from front to back, the top and bottom both angled back to the top and bottom corners of the center section respectively.

now, if i am wrong about the angle of the object in the sense that it was going parallel to me, it resembled (and i am sorry about the geek factor here) the tholian ship from the original star trek series.

i thought two things when i saw it.  first, given the overall shape and angles (slightly darker grey lines) on the side, i wondered if i could be seeing an f-14 navy plane with its' wings folded back.  but, that wasn't possible as it was barely moving and too big.  plus, there were no lights and no exhaust.  there would have been no way for me to know if there was sound as my windows were rolled up and i was driving-- plus, the object was far away (i am guessing three miles).

let me be specific about the lines on the side.  it was hard to tell, but just as with a star destroyers vertical center section, there seemed to be a demarcation where a different angle above it joined in and below it where the opposite symmetrical angle joined in.  so we are talking two lines more or less for sure that were ever so slightly darker than the rest of the object.  there might have been another line above, but it was hard to tell.  also, given the distance it is possible all three lines were canted somewhat down as they proceeded from the back of the craft to the front of the craft.  i say this as i did have the impression of an f-14 from a side view with wings in supersonic configuration (back).  but, again, this was no standard aircraft.  there were no wings whatsoever.

i liked how in this interview sheet a lead color was listed with the grey.  lead is a good descriptive term for the shade of the grey.

then, i thought, could i be seeing a kid's model of a star destroyer that was somehow tethered or being flown.  well, no to this one too--as it was not there seconds later when i turned off and left my vehicle to look.  plus, unless the kid's toy was inflated or some new type of kite, it could not have been stationary or very slowly moving like what i observed.

the object was about thirty-six degrees above the horizon.  my guess is that it was at least two miles away and at an altitude well below airliner level.  my best guess is ten thousand feet.

given my brief observation, i cannot say with one hundred percent certainty that the craft was moving.  i could not focus on the craft long because of traffic that was coming up behind me on this well-traveled road.

when i pulled off there was a police car in the parking lot of the apartment house that was parked there.  he was next to a row of bushes so there was no way for him to have seen what i did.  plus, the police in this area are sometimes not the best people to interact with.  so, i did not approach the officer to report anything or ask anything of him.

as i left my vehicle i did look to the southwest and saw what seemed to be a plane approaching slowly at a moderately low altitude.  the plane was fuzzy to my view and primarily a light the color of sodium street lights as they can be before the lights become differentiated. my guess was it was a commercial airliner but it could have been anything, even a helicopter.  i couldn't stay to find out.  altitude for that aircraft, fifteen thousand feet as a guess.
content.summary: Sun had about set.  driving on busy street. observed angular triangular dark grey object against somewhat lighter sky.  pulled off road to get better view but did not see it.

content.detailedDescription: Will be submiting full story soon.

content.detailedDescription:
I just left the house for an after-dinner walk and as i was about 100 yards n, i saw an orange-yellow pulsating "star-like" object moving rapidly from ne to sw in an almost straight path. as i watched trying to identify the object (i'm a private pilot), it stopped, moved s, halted, then moved n, then resumed its original path, all within a few seconds. it was completely silent, there was no sound whatsoever associated with the object (or any other object in the sky). i knew then this wasn't any typical aircraft. there was no other air traffic in view near the object and no real cloud cover. a light breeze of maybe 5 knots. 

i would estimate its altitude at least 5000 ft but it was hard to judge as the object was very bright but not really "emitting" light, more like just "being really bright in a star-like way" if that makes sense..? the light coming off of it was alternately bright and less bright, pulsating between yellow-orange and red-orange in color. the color seemed to "dull" as the object changed directions, but its directional changes were very fast and very brief & abrupt, then it would resume its sw path. 

as the object moved behind a large tree across from the school parking lot, i tried to gain a better view but when i came around i noticed it had stopped and was mid-directional change again, then resumed its sw path. it seemed to accelerate its movement at that point (still headed sw), because it then covered the distance from approx. 2-3 miles nne to almost directly above me to 2-3 miles sw of my home (a ground distance of prob. 10 miles total) in about 10 seconds. 

the object continued to accelerate so i ran back and into the house to grab my wife (it took maybe 60 seconds total to run back, get her, and come out, and i was watching the object moving sw right up to the point where i went inside). i really wanted her to see it too, but when we came out to the backyard i described what i was seeing and we both scanned the entire sky and it was nowhere to be seen. 

i was bummed. i had seen the unexplained "orbs" on youtube and this looked like a very similar to many of those. i wish i had seen its "departure" or had my phone on the walk.
content.flightPath: Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Pulsating orange/yellow/red orb with starlike features, fast!

content.detailedDescription:
Ufo's over atlantic highlands n.J. 6/29/13
saw 20 of these, but phoned mysteriously turned off while filming, still got three of them. they were heading south towards the ocean. see video.
content.summary: Ufo's over atlantic highlands n.J. 6/29/13 saw 20 of these, but phoned mysteriously turned off while filming, still got three of them. they were heading south.

content.detailedDescription: I went out on my deck at approximately 10:15 pm and noticed a reddish-orange light moving across the sky from the southeast to northwest.  i watched it for approximately 15 or 20 seconds until the tree's in my yard obscured my vision.  then i ran to the back of my house and waited for it to come out from the cover of the trees, but it never came out and i didn't see it again.  i can't say for sure that it was anything extraordinary, but it was something i have never seen in the sky before.
content.summary: Observed redish orange craft moving across the sky moving northwesterly

content.altitude: Treetop, 500 Feet or Less, Over 500 Feet (under cloudcover), Unknown
content.detailedDescription:
After a gorgeous sunset, june 28, 2013. incoming rainstorm from n/e, i, riding bicycle eastbound on st vrain greenway near airport, pass couple w/ 2 dogs, say "hi", they say: "nice night"; i reply "nice night to see some ufo's" we laugh... next passed by cyclist who says "enjoy the show"... mild lightning flashes all around, occasional vertical big bolt... heavy downpour, then decreases, i ride through 'roger's grove', notice two amber orbs, one above the other near southern skyline... i begin ringing bicycle bell and pointing & waving at them, hoping to draw attention. 
 i continue on path toward boulder fairgrounds... orbs appear to be hovering, not static. joined at their lower left by third to complete triangle formation. apparent movement in relation to each other; blinking, flashing, shrinking/growing(?) demonstrate non threatening 'playful vibe'.... i cross roger rd approaching rear of fairgrounds, i hum/sing/chant a tune, hear small party of revelers near a pickup truck; no longer able to see orbs, i circle behind fairgrounds, mentally 'invite' them down to the dirt lot, and then !Boom/crack! above me, loud thunderbolt with no direct lightening. i say "ok, fine, see ya later", turn north, go back to the greenway trail & go home.
*this morning i searched youtube site for: 'ufo longmont'... several entries from years past look nearly identical... also 'ufo lafayette' shows three red lights using same triangle form.
**note: these are clearly distinguishable (to me) as seperate entities making a triangle shape, unlike the huge black triangle that i saw several years ago block out the starlight as it passed over louisville / lafayette. that was one big solid triangle, with a silent & kind of ominous vibe. 

~peace~ 
 aj
content.summary: three amber lights in triangle formation.

content.detailedDescription:
Shortly after 10 p.M. tonight from my back porch, i witnessed a very strange object in the sky about a half mile away and about a half mile above ground.  i screamed for my wife to bring a camera.  she had to look for it and just grabbed her phone instead.  she took three photos but it took her 30 seconds to get her iphone5 and by this time the object had moved well away.  initially, the object was close enough to see the periphery, which clearly appeared to be rectangular with a giant yellow-orange-white flame inside that filled most of the rectangle shape but the flame did not extend beyond the well-defined rectangular borders.  for how bright the light inside the rectangle was, i was surprised to not see much of a halo of light around it.  my first impression was that it was just a very large hot air balloon because i heard what i thought was the sound of propane fuel burning.  i absolutely did not hear an intermittent propeller type sound. it was definitely more of a low steady dull rumble sound.  i had a clear view of most of the horizon.  the object moved from left to right from my vantage point facing northeast, slowly at first, then very fast, faster than a jet airplane.  it moved all the way across the sky easily in less than one minute, including the first 30 seconds or so in which it looked like it was just drifting along very slowly at wind speed.  basically, it just shifted into high gear and took off going away and up.  the object was ascending rapidly without question.  it was moving east to southeast in direction in mostly clear skies at the time.  the long axis of the rectangle seemed perpendicular to the ground at all times even though the pictures seem like it tilted (my wife must have slanted the camera in her rapid response).  the three pictures revealed almost a figure eight light source, almost like some kind of multiple loop circuit.  however, in person, the object looked very bright to the naked-eye like a giant, uniform flame burning upwards.  i would best describe it as a gigantic lantern.  the rectangular or cone-shaped borders seemed black and very thin and the flame inside the borders took up most of the rectangle but not all.  the pencil thin borders were blacker than the darkness around the huge flame inside the object.  it was almost as if the object was transparent between the flame and surface.  there was like a 7/8th moon out that night i believe providing some background light.  any insight into what this object was would be appreciated.  i thought hot air balloons just moved at the same speed as the wind.  

on a side note, i have also seen once a few months back a huge black triangle at night with atleast seven or eight lights around it moving west to east with some of the lights blinking and others not.  this object moved faster than any other i have ever seen in the sky and when it was almost gone over the horizon i heard the big sonic boom like the skies were opening up.
content.summary: Gigantic lantern over nky skies 6/27/13!

content.detailedDescription: Myself and a friend was bass fishing at night. using surface lures i caught a 3# bass released it lit up a smoke  leaned back in the seat looked up to check out the stars..I then saw a satilite moving from south to north i pointed it out to my buddy and we watched it moving like a satilite should we were faceing south when it got to oure 10:30 position aprox..It lite up bright.A real bright white..It then id what i call a j hook and was going to fast for any satilite it was out of sight and over the horizion in 1 maybe 2 seconds it was at high altitude no sound ..I looked at my buddy and his response was wtf.....It blew my cookies.....I stated i hope that was military..But we have nothing that could move that fast or turn that sharp and that fast..Before i could finish my cig. the south horizion,out of oure line of sight was several briliant pure white flashes....We joked that was some starwars sht and we called it a night.I am ex army my buddy lived their for 10+yrs it is a private lake...I used to joke and heckle all ufo sightings ..Nothing like getting gang probed by et..In closing i know that i saw something that was not from this planet and my friend stands with me on this one..Every time i think back or we discuss this it freaks me out was it military can a satilite move in that fashion did we have a 70s flashback lol i dont drink or smoke anything funny for the last 30 yrs i am in my mid 50s and of sound mind.....Thank you for letting vent i am sure you folks take this a little more to heart than some of me other friends.When this subject comes up yes i am at the blunt of their jokes.......
content.summary: Just a night out fishing

content.detailedDescription: One evening as i was one the cell phone outside speaking with a friend. i saw what appeared to be a group of stars, looking towards the nw from my driveway. from where they were positioned they would possibly be over the gulf of mexico. then all of a sudden two stars that were close to eachother started moving in opposite directions. one went n-nw, while the other went s-sw. the one that had gone sw returned after a few minutes or so then went nw. before they had moved they were stationary as stars, for about five minutes or so. they were starlike. after seeing report #48481, i had to report this as well. thank you. ps i stated 4-5 objects as in the group of stars, the two middle ones were the ones that moved off.
content.summary: Same as case 48481

content.detailedDescription:
I believe the sighting was sunday june 9, 2013 (though it could have been the day before).

i'd parked in the cub foods parking lot on a side (closest to 35w south overpass, not nicollet side) i don't normally park on to go to the garden center hut there (and also go into the store). the hut turned out to be closed due to some earlier rain i believe.

after getting out of my car, i noticed a round/oval gray object not far above the roof line of the store  in the sky (a little to my left). (my car was in an e-w orientation to the store. the store faces s.) nothing significant made me look at the object - it just seemed like it was in my line of vision before i turned around to go to the garden hut. at first i thought it was an escaped balloon or something, just my eyes. but i stood there and watched it for about 3-4 minutes. it was moving away from me, like it was going upward and away i'd guess to the n.W. in that it was going upward and back from the top of the building. it was small (smaller than an aspirin) so it was pretty far away. 

the weather was party cloudy i believe more toward overcast. i had seen a ufo before in michigan about 16 years ago so i realized it wasn't a balloon or a regular aircraft. around the time it retreated from sight, to my right, planes were landing at mpls.-st. paul airport - they were coming in over the 35w/62 crosstown exchange - a couple of them, very clear in range of vision, low. i didn't need this gauge to know that whatever i saw wasn't a plane or a balloon. i see a lot of planes and know my aircraft.  

by the time i realized i should take a photo it was moving out of sight. i have an old cell phone (not a smart phone) so i knew the picture quality would be very poor even if i got to it early on in the sighting. emotion wise, i was a little bit excited to see it but because i'd seen one before i wasn't overly excited. i was like "oh wow, that's cool. it's a ufo." i've studied about them and as a journalist have written about them, interviewing scientists and abduction researchers. my sighting years earlier in michigan was much more profound and visceral. (and ironically, it was the same summer i believe i'd covered the july 1997 mufon conference in grand rapids, michigan, and i was with another attendee of that conference). that one was a triangular shaped craft with lights, definitely not a plane, but very high up. 

relatively speaking, the ufo i saw in minneapolis in early june 2013 was lower in the sky, and more of a direct flight path if that makes sense. ultimately i believe i lost sight of the object because it was simply going farther and farther away from me.
content.summary: A grey round/oval craft/shape was observed in daylight in minneapolis. it was very indistinct and distant.

content.detailedDescription:
The crater at haleakala, maui. just after sunrise. i was taking a series of sequential pictures to put together for a panoramic picture. starting at the left side of the crater and going to the right side of the crater. i took three shots taking a total of 13 seconds to complete the series of shots. when i reviewed the pictures i noticed a spot on all three shots. i thought i had dust on my lens. i checked my lens and cleaned it. i took three more shots and when i reviewed them no spots.

when i got home from our vacation, i downloaded all of our pictures into my computer and started to select the ones i wanted to print and frame. when i was selecting the ones from haleakala, i remembered the spots and looked at the pictures carefully. that's when i noticed the spot wasn't in the same area of the picture it was moving across the picture, which proved to me it wasn't a dust particle and the last shot there was a trail. as if it was moving very fast and away from me. i checked the shutter speed and it was 1/1307. i figured that, for what ever it was to leave a trail at that shutter speed it had to be moving very fast. a lot faster than a jet.

of course i showed a lot of people the pictures, in sequence and tried to explain the spots movement and everyone laughed at me.

i have attached the pictures. maybe someone can shed some light as to what it was i caught that morning.
content.summary: Orb observed when reviewing pictures in camera

content.detailedDescription:
I live in chandler, az. on june 18, 2013, i was on my balcony looking west when i saw a very bright light, hovering. it was west of the chandler mall. it has to be within 10-20 miles from me. it would move extremely slow in different directions, right to left, but mainly stayed hovering or stationary. it would start flickering with colored lights, rapidly, then go back to just a bright white light. the flickering lights kept the same distance and pattern. it has been back to the same location for 5 nights since june 18th. sometimes its stays 2 1/2 hours or so and other times i've seen it, it stays maybe not 2 hours. it will either just disappear or seem to fade out. 
is this a satellite??? 
i look forward to hearing back from you after reviewing the photos, video i have attached.
thank you for your time!
content.summary: Bright light, pulsating, changing colors rapidily, hovering

content.detailedDescription:
1. sitting in front yard on couch with husband, watching the stars- and airplanes - overhead.

2. appeared to be a plane or jet coming into the airfield

3. an airplane

4. was on a normal landing path towards airfield but there were no blinking lights so we both watched it. light appeared to be moving straight in, then ?Hovered right to left. moved horizontally west to south. at wich point i pointed with my left hand toward the light and was shocked between my pointer and middle fingers before getiing into a full pointing position. my husband saw the very apparent reaction to being shocked and i actually saw the electricity enter my hand. the light then moved faster creating a waterlike wave in the sky, as though looking through wet glass i could see the body of a dragon-like shape down to it's scales, but not clear by any means. the light faded in thin air to a south-west direction.

5. i was scared and felt like running untill i was shocked. then i immediately felt as if my job was to sit still, watch and understand. i didn't move or speak for at least another 1-2 minutes.

6. again, the light just faded and dissolved into the atmosphere. it was gone
content.summary: Saw assumed plane- stopped forward motion, came straight toward- disolved in thin air

content.detailedDescription: I am trying to remember what year this sighting was.  i believe it was called gritzinger's lake(?) in butler.  my mom was pregnant at the time.  i have a brother born july 1966 another on may 1969 and last on september 1971.  i believe it was 1969, but was wandering if anyone can pinpoint this event?  i remember a large fire ball shooting through the sky and then suddenly stopped.  at first we thought it was a meteor.  it only took maybe a minute for the fire to disappear revealing a silver saucer shaped flying object just hovering maybe 500 yards away.  there was no noise from the craft. the center looked like it may have had windows and looked like it was internally illuminated.  we could see what looked like figures at the windows but it was just a little too far away. i remember being extremely scared when i saw the transformation from fireball to saucer. there were colored lights on the bottom.  we gathered up our things, as did other people at the lake and went to our cars.  my dad drove along the dirt road and the craft followed the cars.  once we hit the highway, i watched as it took off at a very high rate of speed into the night sky.  i was wandering if anyone else ever reported this?  are you able to find out anymore info and relay it back to me?  i have told a few people about this and of course i was teased and ridiculed.  i thought about kecksburg, but it never landed and it flew off. never went fishing back there again, however i would like to visit it but cannot find this place. my parents have since passed, and would never talk about it except the name of the lake and that was it.  not sure if that is the correct spelling of the lake, or if it just sounds like gritzinger's lake.
content.summary: Fireball that suddenly stopped, came towards us, and changed into saucer, hovering with no sound.

content.summary: Fireball straight line path, suddenly stopped and revealed saucer and just hovered before flying off.

content.detailedDescription: While walking dog i noticed a bright planet like object to the north west it would shine very bright then dim to nothing then shine very bright again. watched it hover than move slowly up and down. watched for 10 minutes ran back to house for better view but it had vanished
content.summary: Bright planet like object

content.detailedDescription: Sitting outside observing listening to wildlife.. observing sky ..Was not surprised as have witnessed before but not this spectacular. was orb orange/red erratic movement. vanished within a minute or so.. followed by a militay jet no lights just after burners could be seen //// was amazed
content.summary: Large orb orange red erratic movement followed by military jet

content.detailedDescription:
Northern iowa, in parking lot of residence getting out of car and immediately spotted an glowing orange ball traveling from the northern sky to southeast at a steady but rapid speed. the color made me notice it immediately.  there was no sound, first i thought it was a satellite, not an airplane or aircraft.  much too fast to be an aircraft or satellite,  much too slow to be an asteroid. it faded away on the horizon but seemingly a few seconds too early, i felt i should have seen it longer in the distance.

was heading toward south eastern in iowa which possibly coincides with sighting in south eastern iowa on the same night.

i have seen lots of satellites over the years while fishing in the dark and this object was bright orange unlike those yet about the same height in the sky to the naked eye.

i was just shutting off my radio which was tuned to an earie segment of the coast to coast show by coincidence and so i felt a sense of specialness to the sight.  i wanted to ask others if they saw it too but nobody was around in the darkness near me.
content.summary: Orange ball traveling north to south east

content.detailedDescription: I was outside in front of my home with my husband, just sitting in our driveway looking at the flashing/blinking lights in the sky as always. i was trying to tape the blinking objects in front of me in the sky, towards the right. when out of know where, on my left i saw a huge bright glowing ball that just appeared and kind of descended in a downward position. after the glowing ball appeared i saw planes or helicopters or something in the sky. it was crazy..
content.summary: Orange glowing burst and small flashing objects in sky

content.detailedDescription:
My sister and i were letting the dogs out, when we both noticed a plane flying over head with it's flashing lights. then all of sudden,i was like"uh do you see that?" then i said, oh it's a satellite. just as i said that it gave off a bright white flash of light. 
then we looked each other and i was like that's too fast to be a satellite. so then i came and got my phone and googled where the satellite was and it said not in this area tonight. we are in se portland oregon by mall 205.  then i tried looking on twitter with no luck, so i came here.The plane and the ufo flew off to the north and disappeared. i'm pretty sure a satellite would have taken at least 5 minutes to move the same length as this did in one minute or less.Hopefully we're not the only ones to see it.
content.summary: Saw a plane flashing in sky, then noticed ufo following it

content.detailedDescription: I was standing outside at approximately 11:25 pm and in an instant a blue flash, completely blue covered the entire western sky here in phoenix! if you were to blink, you would have missed it. i was in my apartment complex, and couldn't see anything but the deep blue flash. i am hoping someone else witnessed this phenomena as well to find out what it is. after this encounter my body froze up and had goosebumps everywhere.
content.summary: A complete blue solid flash covered the entire western sky.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting on my front porch on june 28th, 2013 at 9:32 pm. i looked up towards the northeast to see if any stars were visible. what i saw threw that thought out of my mind. my mom had been looking in the same direction for about 4-5 minutes, saying, "that is a weird plane!" when i looked, i saw the same exact thing that i saw on the 4th of july last year (2012). a red light. this time, i had binoculars with me. i looked through the binoculars and saw a bell shaped object that was emitting a bright red light. i handed over the binoculars to my mom, who noticed that it had began to rotate. as we watched (there was 5 different people who saw it) the light rotated to the opposite side of the bell. it rotated completely around three times, then just blinked out of existence. the five of us looked at each other, and just were blown away by what we had just witnessed.
content.summary: Red bell is appearing

content.detailedDescription:
I went out my back door to smoke a cigarette on the porch, and as i was standing there i thought i heard someone yell "let go of me" or something of that nature.  i walked out further into my backyard in the direction of the noise and was looking and listening in the distance trying to see if there was someone being attacked or if it was possibly just some older neighborhood kids playing around.  as i was visually scanning the area i noticed a glowing red object in the upper northwest corner of my field of vision which immediately caught my attention.  it looked like it was too low or too big to be an airplane.  also it did not blink at all - the color and light were consistent the entire time i saw it.  it appeared to be somewhat elongated vertically and at its closest point to me, i may have seen a yellow "flagpole-like" light or beam coming out of the top.  however, the most outstanding characteristic was the speed of the thing.  it passed from where i saw it initially to several miles southeast of my house in a matter of seconds - so fast, it was like something falling (but not quite as fast as a shooting star) except it was traveling horizontally. in fact my first theory was that it was a shooting star, or meteor or some kind of space debris, but as it came closer i lost all confidence in that assessment.  as a point of reference, a high flying plane passing over the length of my house would not even make it from end to end in the time this thing cleared my entire visible range of the sky.  at one point i considered running into the house to grab my binoculars which were maybe 10 feet inside the house, but i was pretty sure i would miss it if i went inside even for the short period of time it would have taken me to grab them. for the most part, i did not feel threatened in any way. although as it approached its nearest point i do remember thinking " maybe i shouldn't be standing out here like a sitting duck" and considered that i should probably go back inside - but of course i didn't. i finally lost sight of it as it got smaller and smaller moving away from me, then just seemed to vanish.  i actually felt like i should have been able to see it diminish in size for a bit longer than i did.  i was just very suddenly gone.

* i have to add a disclaimer here that the beam part may be due to my own vision issues (seeing starbursts or fuzziness around lights), outside of that though, i am 100% confident as to what i saw.*
content.summary: Very very fast, glows reddish/orange  but does not blink, vertically elongated, possibly a yellowish beam coming out of the top,  larger or lower than a high flying airplane

content.detailedDescription:
From my deck i observed the first star-like light at 11:03 pm central time, to the sw about 20 degrees above the horizon, ascending to the north.  duration was about 10 seconds before i lost sight of it due to roof overhang.
no blinking lights associated with this star-like light.
the second star-like light was observed at 11:25 pm about 30 degrees up from the ssw horizon, ascending and moving to the north.  this second star-like light appeared to be either farther away or smaller.  i watched it move from the ssw past the 90 degree mark overhead and then lost it against the night sky.  it appeared to get smaller or farther away as it passed the 90 degree mark directly overhead.  no flashing lights, just a solid star-like light.
both lights were straight-line in their path/direction.
immediately after the 11:03 pm central sighting, i observed 3-5 planes in a west/east and east/west direction, to the south at about 30 - 40 degrees off the horizon.  the planes all had flashing/blinking lights.  additionally there was a helicopter that made at least 3 passes at low altitude over this part of the city, appearing to fly from the se to the nw.  it is not clear whether the plane traffic or helicopter was connected to the sightings, but my guess is that the activity was more than "normal" for this time of night, based on what i've seen in the past at this time.
visibility is clear, low 70's in temperature, and very little if any wind.  lots of stars visible in the night sky.
content.summary: Saw two star-like lights, 11:03 pm central and 11:25 pm central

content.detailedDescription:
Earlier in the day we had a violent thunder storm that had hail and tornadic like activity. i couldn't sleep because the weather channel said that there was another line of storms coming through, although they never did. i decided that i would just sit up in bed for a while and say my evening prayers.I was not tired. i have a habit before i go to bed at night that i always look outside my bedroom window because i love to look at the stars, and i was also checking on the weather that evening. there are no street lights where i live, it is very dark at night. we are surrounded by amish farms. i like it dark when i sleep so all the inside lights were off as well.

as i scanned the area i saw an object that i could not explain. it was cylinder in shape. it stood out against the night sky and it was a blotchy reddish orange color that pulsated. there was no noise; no airplanes, no animals, no cars, no thunder, nothing. it was dead silent. it was moving very slowly from right to left over my neighbors houses. i followed it with my eyes as it passed 2 houses, it had a steady path that was so slow i wondered how it was even staying up in the air. it was not fuzzy looking, it had a solid out line. just under the top of the cylinder it had a thin lighter red band or ring that really stood out to me. as it approached the third house it simply vanished. it was just gone. needless to say i stayed up and watched the sky for about another hour, and it didn't return.

i still an amazed by what i saw, but at the same time it is somewhat unnerving. i do not drink. i do not do drugs. i am not crazy. i know what i saw.
content.summary: I looked outside my bedrm window about 2:30 am. i saw a large cylinder shaped red object moving from right to left slowly above the tree line.
